TopicTitle: Crash to desktop, though not always with a crash notification

Articles.Content:
I had just turned on my computer and opened up KSP, and it starts crashing either when I:

Choose my profile, or,

When I enter a building in KSC. The first time it crashed I got a crash log from it.

The last mod I installed was UmbraSpaceIndustries about a week ago, and I've had no problem.

The last time I played the game I had just entered orbit around Duna.

I exited the game and shut off my computer

Here is the log and the error report, if that may help

These are the mods installed (just typed from my gamedatafolder):

000_USITools

B9_aerospace

CommunityResourcePack

CrossFeedEnabler

ExsurgentEngineering

Firespitter

JSI

KAS

KAX

Kethane

KineTechAnimation

Klockheed_Martian

KWRocketry

MagicSmokeIndustries

MechJeb2

ModuleRCSFX

MP_Nazari

NASAmission

NothKeSerCom

ProceduralFairings

Regolith

ResGen

SmokeScreen

Squad

TacFuelBalancer

UmbraSpaceIndustries

Virgin Kalactic

ModuleManager.2.5.6

If I can give any more information, please let me know. Thanks in advance for your help!

OutOfMemoryException: Out of memory
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) object:__icall_wrapper_mono_array_new_3 (intptr,intptr,intptr,intptr)

  at LibNoise.Unity.Generator.VoronoiCached.ConstructCubeArray () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at LibNoise.Unity.Generator.VoronoiCached..ctor (Double frequency, Double displacement, Int32 seed, Boolean distance) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at PQSMod_VoronoiCraters.OnSetup () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at PQS.Mod_OnSetup () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at PQS.SetupMods () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at PQS.StartSphere (Boolean force) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at PQS+	.MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

Well, I've never seen that one before. Have you tried verifying the game cache?

Well, it appears to be running out of memory which isn't really surprising with that many mods. You will probably need to either remove one or more part mods, reduce your texture resolution or install the Active Texture Management mod to reduce the memory usage.

Well, it appears to be running out of memory which isn't really surprising with that many mods. You will probably need to either remove one or more part mods, reduce your texture resolution or install the Active Texture Management mod to reduce the memory usage.

Sounds good.

Thanks a lot to the both of you
